title: Course Lead-In Strategies for Transitioning to Online Social Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with foundational online learning tools and understanding of basic social science concepts
context.additional_context: An online social education program for non-degree-seeking adult learners, conducting project-based assessments in a smartphone-centric constrained technological environment

learning_goals: Learners can navigate courses and utilize resources on online learning platforms with 90% accuracy.
Learners can sustain peer interactions using online discussion and collaboration tools at least twice weekly.
Learners can analyze online learning environments and develop personalized learning plans through course lead-in strategies.
Learners can apply online research and information organization skills for a social issue analysis project.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
